replies.msg:
Sam determined to attempt the driving test. The probability that he will pass the test each time is 0.4. If he fails the test, he will retake the test until he passes, he can at most attempt the test 4 times in a year. He will buy a car at the end of the year with probability 0.8 if he has passed the test. If not, he will buy a car at the end of the year with probability 0.3. Assume that he has to spend $2000 for the test each time and $10000 to buy a car. Find the probability that he has spent more than $16000 at the end of the year given that he has spent not less than $12000 at the end of the year.
@ğŸ²+é–

quote.msg: Introduction to cuteness and autism

If he fails the test, he will retake the test until he passes, he can at most attempt the test 4 times in a year. He will buy a car at the end of the year with probability 0.8 if he has passed the test. If not, he will buy a car at the end of the year with probability 0.3. Assume that he has to spend $2000 for the test each time and $10000 to buy a car. Find the probability that he has spent more than $16000 at the end of the year given that he has spent not less than $12000 at the end of the year.
